compare.header_help: Here you can input two instagram accounts that you have access to and you can compare and analyze their statistics side by side.

display.top_posts_help: Top posts from the last %s posts of both accounts.

display.text1: The API is used to get current information of a generated report that is available to your account.

display.source_help: The source parameter accepts the name of the source of details. (ex: instagram )

index.title: Home
index.subheader: Analyze and track your social media accounts

reports.subheader: Check out some of our demo analytics reports.

presentation.subheader: Track evolution of your social media accounts with beautiful statistics and charts.

one.subheader: Track progress of any Instagram Account with day by day analytics of Followers, Following, Uploads, Engagement Rate and much more.

two.subheader: We're giving you access to all the day by day analytics and generate accurate and free stats of any account that we have in our database.

three.subheader: We are even sending you notifications of your tracked social media accounts progress by email.

box.pdf_exports_text: Easy to use and always ready PDF exports of the generated report.
box.future_projections_text: Based on statistics generated by the accounts growth.
box.comparison_tool_text: Compare your statistics with your competitors and see who wins.

directory.subheader: Find various instagram accounts by different criteria, we've got you covered!

input.title: Website title
input.default_language_help: To add more languages, please consult the documentation.
input.logo_help: jpg, jpeg, png and svg accepted. Recommended size: Max height of 40px and transparrent.
input.favicon_help: jpg, jpeg, png and ico accepted.
input.analytics_code_help: Insert only the ID. Example: UA-22222222-33
input.email_reports_help: Enabling email reports will trigger the cron job to send updates to users about their instagram accounts progress. The cron must be set up in order for this to work
input.email_reports_default_help: If enabled, all new users will have email reports activated by default.
input.email_reports_favorites_help: By enabling this, people who just simply favorite an account will get email notifications too. This only works when the price of the reports is set to 0 (disabled).
input.directory_help: Set the permissions of who can access the directory page of IG Users.
input.directory_pagination_help: How many results you want to see per show more in the Directory page.
input.ads_help: These fields accept text or html.
input.index_ad: Ad Code for the Index page
input.report_ad: Ad Code for the Report page
input.recaptcha_help: If enabled, you must add the public and private key from Google Recaptcha API
input.social_help: Social links to be displayed in the footer of the website. Enter only the id / name of the page
input.smtp_help: If there are no values entered in this field then the system will try to use the default mail function.
input.smtp_from_help: The email that the users get the email from / the 'reply-to' email ( registration / email activation / lost password )
input.store_help: Please refer to the Documentation to find out where to get the keys.
input.store_unlock_report_price_help: Set to 0 if you want to make all reports available to everyone. Setting to 0 will make the cron check all the reports available, not only those which are purchased.
input.store_unlock_report_time_help: Set the amount of time a report is available to the user after purchasing. Set to 0 if you want the user to have the Report for an ulimited time after purchase.
input.store_user_default_points_help: Default points that a user gets upon registering.
input.cron_url_help: The cron job url that you need to use when creating your cronjob.
input.cron_help: Please refer to the Documentation to find out how to setup the Cron.
input.cron_queries_help: How many accounts to check in one Cron Execution. For optimum performance, select a value between 1 to 5
input.cron_mode_help:
ACTIVE - The cronjob will update only active reports.
ALL - The cronjob will update all the users.
input.cron_auto_add_missing_logs_help: When enabled the system cron will try to automatically calculate logs that were not added. Ex: If a report does not get updated for 3 days and the fourth day the cron runs on that report, it will automatically calculate approximately the other 3 days as well.
input.credentials_email_template_help: This email template is used when somebody registers through social media. This email will notify the user of their new account and their generated username and password.
input.admin_email_notification_emails_help: Emails that will receive a notification when one of the bottom actions are performed. Add valid email addresses separated by a comma.
input.admin_new_user_email_notification_help: Receive an email when a new users registers to the website.
input.admin_new_payment_email_notification_hel: Receive an email when a new payment is successfully processed.
input.proxy_help: Enabling Proxy will determine the script to try and send request to instagram via Proxies that you have added in Proxies Management
input.proxy_exclusive_help: If enabled, the requests to instagram will only be sent with proxies ( not from the current server ). If not enabled then there will be an approximate 50% chance to use the current server.
input.proxy_timeout_help: After how many seconds a proxy request should timeout
input.proxy_failed_requests_pause_help: After how many failed requests a proxy request should pause
input.proxy_pause_duration_help: After how many minutes a proxy request should be used again after a pause

button.test_email_help: It will send an email to the value from the From field that you set above. Make sure to first save the settings!

success_message.email: The test email has been sent successfully!

email_template_keys.help: <u>This form supports html so that you can format the email how you want.</u>
email_template_keys.name: {{NAME}} - Name of the user
